title: Understanding the Natural Logarithm
text: The natural logarithm function, represented as ln(x), is only defined for positive values of $$x$$. This means that the argument inside the ln function must be greater than zero.

title: Setting Conditions for the Argument Inside the Logarithm
text: Since $$\ln(4x+17)$$ requires the argument to be positive, set up the inequality $$4x+17>0$$.

title: Determine the Domain from the Inequality
text: Solve the inequality $$4x+17>0$$ to find the domain of the function h(x).

title: Understanding the Shift in Range Caused by Subtraction
text: The function $$\ln(4x+17)-5$$ is a vertical shift of the function $$\ln(4x+17)$$. Subtracting $$5$$ shifts the entire graph downward but does not change the range from $$(-\infty,\infty)$$.
